div1.head: Military Orders for Albert E. Truby, August 11, 1900
div1.opener:
FROM GEN. ALBERT E. TRUBY
SPECIAL ORDERS,
No. 188.
HEADQUARTERS OF THE ARMY,
ADJUTANT GENERAL'S OFFICE,
Washington, August 11, 1900.
Extract.
div1.p:
1. By direction of the Secretary of War, 1st Lieutenant
Albert E. Truby, assistant surgeon, U. S. Army, is relieved
from duty in the Department of Western Cuba, to take effect
from August 2, 1900, and from further duty with the 1st U.S.
Infantry, to take effect upon the expiration of the leave of ab-
sence granted him by the commanding officer, 3d Battalion of
that regiment.
div1.closer:
BY COMMAND OF LIEUTENANT GENERAL MILES: H. C. CORBIN,
Adjutant General. RECEIVED
AUG. 13 1900
S. G. O.
HEAD QUARTERS OF THE ARMY,
ADJUTANT GENERALS OFFICE.
OFFICIAL
COPY.
Lt Truby
Thro Surgeon General.
